intro: Senecio meyeri-johannis, commonly known as the Blue Echeveria, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features dense, compact rosettes of blue-gray foliage with a slightly fuzzy texture. The plant produces tall, branched inflorescences of yellow flowers during the summer months. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its attractive appearance and ease of care, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and container planting.
